document.docAuthor: Gess, Friedrich W. & Gess, Sarah K.
document.masterDocTitle: Geographical distributions of Bembix (Hymenoptera, Crabronidae, Bembicinae) in southern Africa, with notes on biology

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Geographical distributions of Bembix (Hymenoptera, Crabronidae, Bembicinae) in southern Africa, with notes on biology

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Albany Museum and Rhodes University, Grahamstown, 6139 South Africa
Albany Museum and Rhodes University, Grahamstown, 6139 South Africa

figureCitation.captionText: Figure 13. Bembix spp.: a Bembix namibensis, female, male b Bembix ochracea, female, male c Bembix olivata, female, male d Bembix regnata, female, male e Bembix scaura, female, male f Bembix sibilans, female, male. (approximate lengths of females: a 20.5 mm; b 16.5 mm; c 15.5 mm; d 18 mm; e 20 mm; f 19.5 mm)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Bembix ochracea
Handlirsch was described from a single damaged specimen "aus Transvaal". Parker referred to a specimen from "Cap" , while Arnold recorded it from Willowmore.
Bembix opima
Turner, sunk into synonymy by Arnold, was described from Willowmore (January and February, Dr. H. Brauns).

NAMIBIA: Otjinungwa (SE 1712 Ab) [= 17.17S , 12.26E ], 17-22.xi.1970 (collector?), 2 ♀♀ [NMNW]; Marienfluss, 4-8 km S [of] Otjinungwa (SE 1712 Ac) [ 17.20S , 12.25E ], 21-22.xi.1970 (collector?), 1 ♀, 1 ♂ [NMNW]; near Two Palms, Uniab River ( 19.53S , 13.54E ), 28.iii.2004 (F.W. and S.K. Heliotropium
sp. not tubulosum , Boraginaceae ) [AMGS]; circa 17 km W [of] Khorixas ( 20.28S , 14.51E ), 16.iii.2004 (F.W. and S.K. Gess), 3 ♂♂ (2 ♂♂ visiting pink flowers of
Hermbstaedtia
sp., Amaranthaceae , 1 ♂visiting yellow flowers of

Recorded from nine plant families: Boraginaceae (
Heliotropium
sp. not tubulosum ); Acanthaceae (
Monechma genistifolium
(Engl.) C.B. Clarke); Amaranthaceae (
Hermbstaedtia
sp.); Asteraceae (
Geigeria pectidea
(DC.) Harv. and
Geigeria
sp. ( Asteraceae )); Aizoaceae (Mesembryanthema,
Brownanthus kuntzei
(Schinz) Ihlenf. & Bittrich,
Psilocaulon salicornioides
(Pax) Schwantes ( Aizoaceae : Mesembryanthema) and
Psilocaulon glareosum
(Berger) Dinter & Schwantes; non-Mesembryanthema,
Galenia papulosa
(Eckl. & Zeyh.) Sond.); Zygophyllaceae (
Tribulus
sp. and
Zygophyllum simplex
L.); Apiaceae (
Deverra denudata
(Viv.) Pfisterer & Podl.); Fabaceae ( Mimosoideae ,
Acacia
sp.); Apocynaceae (
Carissa haematocarpa
(Eckl.) DC; formerly Asclepiadaceae ,
Gomphocarpus filiformis
(E. Mey.) D. Dietr.).
